column2: Average Class Size and Class Size Distribution (Elementary)\r2016-172016-172016-172016-172017-182017-182017-182017-182018-192018-192018-192018-19\rAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# ofAverage# of# of# of\rGrade\rClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*ClassClasses*Classes*Classes*\rLevel\rSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSizeSize\r1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+1-2021-3233+\rK\r182218312013\r\r1\r2111922112\r\r2\r20212112232\r\r3\r1812262242\r\r4\r242262232\r\r5\r272242252\r\r6\r19222312222\r\rOther**\r141\r*Numbe r of classes indicates how many classes fall into each size category (a range of total students per class).\r** “Other” category is for multi-grade level classes.\r\r\rProfessional Development provided for Teachers\r\rMeasure2017-182018-192019-20\rNumber of school days dedicated to Staff Development and Continuous Improvement332932\r\rEach year
column3: targeted professional improvement activities are provided for teachers
column5: and other employees. Our current professional\rdevelopment has focused on improving the content and delivery of our Language Arts in the area of Comprehension and Writing
column6: English Language\rDevelopment and Math instruction. Activities reflect the school's goals and objectives and are part of our School School Plan for Student Achievement.\r\rAll professional development will be consistent with all four School Plan for Student Achievement (SPSA) goals: English Language Arts
column10: and English Language Development.\r\rIn-class and after-school PD support with Illuminate.\r\rOn-going Search and Rescue PD during school and after-school PD.\r\rOn-going ELPAC overview/ class support/ certification PD and support.\r\rWe will continue to support the academic success of our students.  On-going analysis of assessment data will continue to guide the needs for professional\rdevelopment.\r\rThe ILT will attend district-wide professional development.\r\rTeachers have been provided grade level deconstructed CCSS. Teachers will have opportunities to review deconstructed CCSS for lesson design and to\rcreate on-going common assessments during their weekly collaboration time
column11: and review data to create differentiated small group instruction.\r\rAn emphasis on the reading-writing connection and how to conceptualize mathematical concepts will be the focus for all CCSS professional development\rconducted at the site.  Teachers will continue to develop comprehension skills through the close-reading method with an increase in the use of\rinformational text.  Teachers will use the Gradual Release of Responsibility (GRR) method to deliver instruction
column12: in which students will apply their learning\rthrough productive group work
column13: and strategies for English Learners will be incorporated.\r\rTeachers will be provided with professional resource books to assist them in the implementation of research-based practices and to transition to CCSS.\rAdditionally
column14: the district resource teacher assigned to our site will assist with coaching and providing professional development.\r\rGuidelines have been established to demonstrate the implementation of their learning through professional development to reflect the consistency of\rpractice during lesson delivery and in the classroom environment.\r\rTeachers have received professional development training NextGen math computerized program and continue to receive training for Achieve3000.\rAdditionally
column15: ongoing focus during collaboration time and professional development will assist teachers in implementing systems and use data to create\rsmall group instruction based on students needs.  ... Unnamed: 6
